t: Matthew 16
The*p Pharisees also with the Sadducees came, and tempting desired him that he would shew them a sign from heaven.
He*p answered and said unto them, When*r it*r is*r evening,*r ye*r say,*r It*r will*r be*r fair*r weather:*r for*r the*r sky*r is*r red.*r

And*rp in*r the*r morning,*r It*r will*r be*r foul*r weather*r to*r day:*r for*r the*r sky*r is*r red*r and*r lowring.*r O*r ye*r hypocrites,*r ye*r can*r discern*r the*r face*r of*r the*r sky;*r but*r can*r ye*r not*r discern*r the*r signs*r of*r the*r times?*r

A*rp wicked*r and*r adulterous*r generation*r seeketh*r after*r a*r sign;*r and*r there*r shall*r no*r sign*r be*r given*r unto*r it,*r but*r the*r sign*r of*r the*r prophet*r Jonas.*r And he left them, and departed.
And*p when his disciples were come to the other side, they had forgotten to take bread.
Then*p Jesus said unto them, Take*r heed*r and*r beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r of*r the*r Sadducees.*r
And*p they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have taken no bread.
Which*p when Jesus perceived, he said unto them, O*r ye*r of*r little*r faith,*r why*r reason*r ye*r among*r yourselves,*r because*r ye*r have*r brought*r no*r bread?*r
Do*rp ye*r not*r yet*r understand,*r neither*r remember*r the*r five*r loaves*r of*r the*r five*r thousand,*r and*r how*r many*r baskets*r ye*r took*r up?*r
Neither*rp the*r seven*r loaves*r of*r the*r four*r thousand,*r and*r how*r many*r baskets*r ye*r took*r up?*r

How*rp is*r it*r that*r ye*r do*r not*r understand*r that*r I*r spake*r it*r not*r to*r you*r concerning*r bread,*r that*r ye*r should*r beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r of*r the*r Sadducees?*r
Then*p understood they how that he bade them not beware of the leaven of bread, but of the doctrine of the Pharisees and of the Sadducees.
When*p Jesus came into the coasts of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, saying, Whom*r do*r men*r say*r that*r I*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r am?*r
And*p they said, Some say that thou art John the Baptist: some, Elias; and others, Jeremiah, or one of the prophets.
He*p saith unto them, But*r whom*r say*r ye*r that*r I*r am?*r
And*p Simon Peter answered and said, Thou art the Christ, the Son of the living God.

And*p Jesus answered and said unto him, Blessed*r art*r thou,*r Simon*r Barâ€“jona:*r for*r flesh*r and*r blood*r hath*r not*r revealed*r it*r unto*r thee,*r but*r my*r Father*r which*r is*r in*r heaven.*r

And*rp I*r say*r also*r unto*r thee,*r That*r thou*r art*r Peter,*r and*r upon*r this*r rock*r I*r will*r build*r my*r church;*r and*r the*r gates*r of*r hell*r shall*r not*r prevail*r against*r it.*r

And*rp I*r will*r give*r unto*r thee*r the*r keys*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven:*r and*r whatsoever*r thou*r shalt*r bind*r on*r earth*r shall*r be*r bound*r in*r heaven:*r and*r whatsoever*r thou*r shalt*r loose*r on*r earth*r shall*r be*r loosed*r in*r heaven.*r
Then*p charged he his disciples that they should tell no man that he was Jesus the Christ.

From*p that time forth began Jesus to shew unto his disciples, how that he must go unto Jerusalem, and suffer many things of the elders and chief priests and scribes, and be killed, and be raised again the third day.
Then*p Peter took him, and began to rebuke him, saying, Be it far from thee, Lord: this shall not be unto thee.

But*p he turned, and said unto Peter, Get*r thee*r behind*r me,*r Satan:*r thou*r art*r an*r offence*r unto*r me:*r for*r thou*r savourest*r not*r the*r things*r that*r be*r of*r God,*r but*r those*r that*r be*r of*r men.*r
Then*p said Jesus unto his disciples, If*r any*r man*r will*r come*r after*r me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross,*r and*r follow*r me.*r
For*rp whosoever*r will*r save*r his*r life*r shall*r lose*r it:*r and*r whosoever*r will*r lose*r his*r life*r for*r my*r sake*r shall*r find*r it.*r
For*rp what*r is*r a*r man*r profited,*r if*r he*r shall*r gain*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r lose*r his*r own*r soul?*r or*r what*r shall*r a*r man*r give*r in*r exchange*r for*r his*r soul?*r
For*rp the*r Son*r of*r man*r shall*r come*r in*r the*r glory*r of*r his*r Father*r with*r his*r angels;*r and*r then*r he*r shall*r reward*r every*r man*r according*r to*r his*r works.*r
Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r There*r be*r some*r standing*r here,*r which*r shall*r not*r taste*r of*r death,*r till*r they*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r coming*r in*r his*r kingdom.*r
